info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 21 at 2:57PM CDT by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Pike and southwestern Montgomery Counties through 330 PM CDT... At 257 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms extending from near Albert Pike Recreation Area to Daisy State Park. These storms were nearly stationary. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Daisy... Daisy State Park... Albert Pike Recreation Area... Little Missouri Falls Recreatio... Bear Creek Public Use Area... Fancyhill... Hopper... Lodi... Langley... New Hope in Pike County... Kirby... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
